newsitem.title: PERU: Peru posts Jan-July economic growth of 2.0 pct.
newsitem.headline: Peru posts Jan-July economic growth of 2.0 pct.

text.p: The Peruvian economy grew 2.0 percent between January and July, compared to 8.7 percent in the same period of 1995, the National Institute of Statistics and Information (INEI) said Wednesday.
The INEI added that year-on-year Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth was 5.1 percent in July, compared with 7.4 percent year-on-year growth in the same month last year.
The government is predicting annual growth of between three and four percent in 1996, down from initial projections of five to six percent due to an economic slowdown.
In 1995, the economy expanded 7.0 percent, Latin America's second-highest growth rate, down from 13.1 percent in 1994, according to revised central bank figures.
The accumulated growth between January and July was led by the agriculture sector, up 4.7 percent, followed by 3.4 percent growth for mining and 3.0 percent in the trade sector.
The construction sector contracted 6.4 percent in the same period, while fishing was off 6.3 percent, the INEI said.
